means: 隐瞒( shroud的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: For years the teaching of acting has been shrouded in mystery.
sentence.Network_cn: 多年以来表演教学一直蒙着神秘的面纱。

sentence.Network_en: His demise is as shrouded in mystery as ever.
sentence.Network_cn: 他的死亡一直笼罩着神秘色彩。

sentence.Network_en: Mist shrouded the outline of Buckingham Palace.
sentence.Network_cn: 雾霭蒙蒙，白金汉宫若隐若现。

entry.def: A shroud is a cloth which is used for wrapping a dead body.
You can refer to something that surrounds an object or situation as a shroud of something.

example.ex: ...a parked car huddled under a shroud of grey snow...
example.tran: 车身上覆着一层灰白色积雪的停放着的汽车

example.ex: Ministers are as keen as ever to wrap their activities in a shroud of secrecy.
example.tran: 部长们都一如既往地迫切想要将他们的行动搞得神神秘秘的。

entry.def: If something has been shrouded in mystery or secrecy, very little information about it has been made available.

example.ex: For years the teaching of acting has been shrouded in mystery.
example.tran: 多年以来表演教学一直蒙着神秘的面纱。

example.ex: ...the secrecy which has shrouded the whole affair.
example.tran: 笼罩着整件事的诡秘气氛

entry.def: If darkness, fog, or smoke shrouds an area, it covers it so that it is difficult to see.

example.ex: Mist shrouded the outline of Buckingham Palace.
example.tran: 雾霭蒙蒙，白金汉宫若隐若现。
